derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from French, or from Latin infantilis, from infans, infant- (see infant)

entry.def: Infantile behaviour or illnesses are typical of very young children.
If you accuse someone or something of being infantile, you think that they are foolish and childish.

example.ex: This kind of humour is infantile and boring.
example.tran: 这种幽默既幼稚又无聊。

means.word_mean: 2. of or relating to infants or infancy;
3. being or befitting or characteristic of an infant;
